dt: {bc}the time before something happens or before a specified period ends {bc}{sx|meantime||}

dt.t: in the {wi}meanwhile{/wi} colleges and universities have become somewhere near one hundred times more complex

shortdef: the time before something happens or before a specified period ends : meantime

dt.t: {wi}meanwhile{/wi}, however, new projects are being undertaken this year
You can set the table, and {wi}meanwhile{/wi} I'll start cooking dinner.

dt: {bc}at or during the same time {bc}while something else is being done or was being done

dt.t: You can set the table. {it}In the meanwhile{/it}, I'll start making dinner.
She spent four years studying for her law degree. {it}In the meanwhile{/it}, she continued to work at the bank.

dt: {bc}during the time before something happens or before a specified period ends

dt.t: The new computers won't arrive until next week, but we can keep using the old ones {it}in the meanwhile{/it}.

shortdef: at or during the same time : while something else is being done or was being done
during the time before something happens or before a specified period ends
